proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count (Chapter 1 Only)
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided text (Chapter 1) is processed as a single chunk, as its length is significantly below the safety limit of 125,000 characters.

execution_plan.description: Prefatory material (Shanti Patha) and Adhyaya 1 (Mantras 1-67) along with Prakashika commentary.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Adhyaya is the largest division, but the Mantra (with its subsequent commentary) serves as the core semantic and parseable unit for detailed analysis.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra (or verse) begins with the verse number enclosed in double vertical bars.

end_pattern.description: The content of a Mantra unit (including the original verse and its commentary) ends just before the start of the next Mantra, or the concluding chapter marker.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial 'शान्तिपाठः' and its detailed explanation ('मे – मम वाग्...') should be grouped together and treated as a single, 'Prefatory' or 'Shanti' section before the first numbered Mantra (`हरिः ओम् । चित्रो ह वै...॥ १ ॥`). Also, handle the short sections like [मङ्गलाचरणम्] and [आचार्यवन्दनम्] immediately preceding Mantra 1's commentary as part of the overall preface to the Adhyaya.
